reasoning.step2:
I'll evaluate each extracted field with step-by-step reasoning and a confidence estimate.

1) GrandTotal.Amount = 2944.36
- Evidence: Text shows "Endbetrag EUR 2.944,36" which matches formatting (comma as decimal). 
- Internal check: Net 2.676,69 + VAT 267,67 = 2.944,36 matches exactly.
- OCR risk: low (clear numeric line).
- Confidence: 98%

2) Invoice.Date = "29-01-2024"
- Evidence: Text near signature area: "Wien, 29-01-2024". This is standard invoice date placement.
- Ambiguity: There is also a delivery/voucher date 22-01-2024 and 23-01-2024; but "Wien, 29-01-2024" strongly indicates invoice issuing date.
- Confidence: 95%

3) Sender.VatId = "ATU22642807"
- Evidence: Text includes "ATU22642807" on a line labeled earlier as ATU... and later another UID line shows "UID-Nr.: ATU 43349701" — wait: OCR shows two different ATU numbers: ATU22642807 (isolated) and UID-Nr.: ATU 43349701.
- Ambiguity: Which is sender VAT? The standalone "ATU22642807" appears above payment terms; "UID-Nr.: ATU 43349701" explicitly labeled UID-Nr. suggests 43349701 might be the VAT. Risk of misassignment.
- Additional check: Company header "SENNA Nahrungsmittel GmbH & CoKG" — which VAT is correct is unclear.
- Confidence: 40%

4) Vat.Rate = 10 (%)
- Evidence: Text shows "+ 10 % Mehrwertsteuer" on the VAT line.
- Interpretation straightforward.
- Confidence: 99%

5) Net.Amount = 2676.69
- Evidence: Text shows "Auftragssumme 2.676,69" which is the order sum/net amount.
- Internal check: Combined with VAT 267,67 yields stated end amount.
- OCR risk: low.
- Confidence: 98%

6) Vat.Amount = 267.67
- Evidence: VAT line shows "267,67" under amount for 10% VAT.
- Internal check: 10% of 2.676,69 equals 267,669 -> rounded to 267,67 matches.
- Confidence: 98%

Summary of uncertainties: main ambiguity is Sender.VatId due to two ATU numbers in the document; all monetary fields and invoice date and VAT rate are well-supported.

1) GrandTotal.Amount: 2944.36
